topic.title: Pro-abortion reporters ban math for Steve King ... not for me though!
topic.body:
Alright, here is CNN's newest Crusade:  https://www.cnn.com/2019/08/14/politics/steve-king-rape-incest-comments/index.html  King said *"What if we went back through all the family trees and just pulled those people out that were products of rape and incest? Would there be any population of the world left if we did that?  Considering all the wars and all the rape and pillage that has taken place ... I know I can't certify that I was not a part of a product of that."*  This is now being held up as a "bizarre comment" worthy of expulsion from Congress, comparable to fighting for the Confederacy against the U.S. government.

So on this last vestige of the free internet, what is the math?  Well, we can look up "Pregnancy from rape" on Wikipedia, which says 25,000 to 32,000 pregnancies result from rape per year in the U.S.  Now the total births per year in the U.S. should be the 12.4/1000 population * (329,000,000 population) (from their article on demographics of the U.S.) = 4,080,000 births yearly.  Crunch those numbers and get an astounding 1 in 148.  Either rape really works (still), or Wikipedia is full of shit (possible), or my math is wrong (well, I just went on a chocolate binge and my judgment may be impaired).

Now rape in ancient times was probably not LESS than during the Age of Political Correctness, unless all those rules about talking don't actually do anything to stop a penis (possible).  So if we take (1-0.0068) to the Nth power, and get a result of less than 1/329,000,000, then that is the number of conceptions where you can pretty much guarantee one was a rape for every single American.  That is log 0.9932 (1/329000000) or ln(1/329000000)/ln(0.9932).  Which works out to 2874 conceptions.

Before you multiply that by 20 (the old generation time), remember that it takes two to tango.  Going back in the pedigree you add 1+2+4+8... so we want log2(2874).  That's 11.5 generations.  Which means that sometime within the last 230 years -- since 1789, when the Constitution was passed - EVERY SINGLE AMERICAN has had an ancestor conceived by rape.

At least, unless some of those ancestors are the same, in which case the numbers are smaller, but then they're a product of incest.

topic.title: ZeroNet should focus on developing legal infrastructure and establishing legitimacy in media
topic.body:
Some people keep talking about Tor -- but what we need is the OTHER direction.  There's nothing illegal about talking to people about things that the overlords of Google and Facebook think looks bad for their companies.  There's no reason why anybody should even need Tor here unless their interests run in a few fairly narrow directions -- which is the same as is true for "the internet" because ZeroNet is simply the Internet, run by people instead of by corporations.  NO OTHER DIFFERENCE.  We should see more development of "whitelists" of forums and files that users have looked over and decided have no legal issues (not even civil), so that absolutely anybody feels comfortable seeding them.  I say whitelists because of course there are always files people disagree about or which are OK for some countries and not others, the copyright extension treaty and that kind of craziness.  Users should feel free to examine others case by case.

Most specifically though, we need a legit infrastructure to help reassure and support those users who want to play it legal.  DMCA offers safe harbor IF you can be reached and respond to complaints.  Somebody here might get served with a DMCA notice and not check ZeroMail, and lose safe harbor, or check it only after logging in and starting to seed, etc.  So some specialized tools that would allow you the seeder to authorize "some guy" who wants to shoulder the burden of DMCA notice watching and block your file-seeding/warn you of what's going on for that reason alone could give thousands of people safe harbor and he might not even get a notice, so that's really an improvement in efficiency and safety.

Remember, Tor is NOT a magic force field.  On 4/5/19 I think the Germans shut down "Wall Street Market", a huge darknet website.  SAME DAY, Firefox "accidentally" let their main certificate for plug-ins expire, and all the plug-ins were disabled.  THAT INCLUDED NOSCRIPT IN TOR.  I haven't seen an update, but I bet there are hundreds, even thousands of people who didn't notice the little S symbol was gone before they wandered in to a government replacement for that site with some very special scripts running...  Feel free to correct me if I'm wrong.

topic.title: The comic buried treasure at the center of Islam
topic.body:
Students of history may know that Muhammad basically took over a big pilgrimage site by force, thereby making great profit and fame.  They may also know that (after he smashed miscellaneous idols) the one big uncontested ruler of that roost was a black rock that people said had fallen from the sky, i.e. a meteorite.  Perhaps less well known (indeed, I may be making a crank theory here) let's note that this black rock turned up very shortly after the Christians turned the shrine of Elagabalus in Emesa into the Church of St John the Divine, and smashed a certain Black Stone at the center of it, a massive meteorite which the transgender Roman emperor Elagabalus had gone all over the city with in a chariot praying to it and had a big temple built for in Rome, until he died and it got shipped back home.  A network of Sabean traders linked the two sites.

Now anyway, the Church of St John is since turned into the Great Mosque of Al-Nuri, damaged during the siege of Homs.  The Black Rock was smashed at a known site in the courtyard.  So we have possible/probable fragments of the Black Stone that the entire pilgrimage to Mecca centers around, lying untended just under a bombed-out mosque, waiting for somebody to scoop them up and prove they match up with the ones in the little lensy thingy that the Muslims stare into.  But if the Muslims knew it was the Elagabalus stone they'd probably decry it as a pagan abomination. ;)  Oh, if someone could just _dig_ it would be so hilarious.

topic.title: Can ZeroNet do general purpose "domain names"?
topic.body:
The DNS system was a racket from the beginning.  For years I kept bookmarks of IP addresses just to avoid the unreliable servers, and now they an official Station on the Via Censorosa.  How the fuck did these chiselers manage to convince the whole world they have to use the same dictionary, run by them????

Now .bit looks like a commendable contender in many regards... still, it is (a) not free, since the NameCoin infrastructure imposes a proof-of-work burden that translates to money, and (b) it puts its addresses at risk of any crypto-currency meltdown that could happen whenever enough city governments get tired of paying untraceable ransoms.

I feel what we need is something more like (a) "some guy who has a dictionary file you can edit", (b) times 1000.  In other words, directions that work like domain names but are less formal, less verified, less expensive, less exclusive, and hopefully run by so many different people that the trademark lawyers can't find them all.  Which reminds me a bit of ZeroNet; hence the question.

topic.title: Biological mechanism and treatment of pedophilia
topic.body:
It has occurred to me that the waves of 8chan refugees and the freedom of ZeroNet might allow some actual, serious, _biological_ discussion of what mechanisms might lead to pedophilia _with a chance of getting feedback from people who actually suffer from the condition_.

My tentative understanding of how sexual attraction works is that there is a much-disputed organ, the vomeronasal organ, which may not exist in humans or may exist in a very rudimentary form, which is tasked with detecting pheromones - scent signals - from other humans.  The effect of pheromones is well known to be real in _some_ way: typical men will have higher salivary testosterone levels if they sniff a sample of sweat from women who were ovulating rather than those who were not.

Based on other species, the neurons that receive signals from the VNO are single cells that carry impulses all the way from the nose (via the very obscure "terminal nerve", the 0th cranial nerve) to the hypothalamus, where they signal by releasing GnRH (gonadotropin releasing hormone).  GnRH has a complex pattern of pulses of activity and inactivity, but the net effect is that when properly deployed it causes luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) to be produced.  LH activates hormone secreting cells (Leydig or thecal cells) which secrete androgens; in women the androgens are converted to estrogen while in men they are stored by ABP.  FSH directly stimulates gamete production/maturation.

So what's going on here?  I think every time a normal person gets a dose of pheromone, it causes a sexual activation, and part of that MAY be to do operant conditioning to convince the person that this is linked to an ideal sexual appearance.  But at this point the trail starts to peter out - nobody in government seems very interested in _curing_ pedophilia, just using it as an excuse to censor the internet.  For that matter, studies of normal sexual attraction are rare, though they've figured out that average faces are typically most attractive (presumably because the operant conditioning of all the potential mates works out to an average)  So for example there are ZERO studies in the entire scientific literature testing what happens if you hire some sex workers to try their best on a pedophile, which seems like the first most obvious control for any experiment at all.

Still, I remember that as a kid 6-7 I had the common phenomenon of "puppy love", attraction to children my own age (oddly, I remember much older women being attractive BEFORE that, but for a while they became less so).  My assumption is that kids in age-selected groups start to condition on the pheromones they encounter there.  In my case, as usual, that attraction changed year to year, as it usually does.  So my hypothesis is that in pedophiles something breaks this: they stop reacting to pheromones and stay stuck at some stage of development.

The question then is: (a) can we find experiences from pedophiles that can explain what the thing is that actually broke their mental updating?  It might be something like a physical injury that damages one of the terminal nerves, a vascular accident that damages part of the brain, or something else at the relevant point of childhood.  And of course (b) can you TREAT a pedophile by exposing him to a super strong dose of pheromones, whether from sweaty "nasty" women with an excess of scent, or by chemical purification or synthetic production?  Heck, I remember that being in a mouse room the _mouse_ pheromones would change how I looked at any women I encountered, even the ones I thought of as highly unattractive (e.g. Asians)... and to be honest, some of the change really had a long term effect in weakening those particular aesthetic distinctions.  I should also note that (c) _if_ the pathway is entirely destroyed, it should be possible to bypass it by some means which may involve neural stimulation (Nasal TMS?) or maybe snorting a permeable GnRH like cocaine.  But it would have to be really subtle or people would condition on the dope instead of the sexual signal - Indians used tobacco for centuries without getting cancer because they thought their addiction impulse came from a ceremony, but once they know it comes from a cigarette... 

I don't believe that pedophilia is an "orientation".  There are evolutionary reasons why "man" and "woman" may be defined as potential targets of attraction, but within those categories people should be malleable.  I don't think it's necessarily realistic or a priority to expect all of a pedophile's attraction to children to be forgotten, but as I said above, I think _most_ people _remember_ a time long ago when they found children attractive, without being pedophiles now.  Children don't really produce much if any pheromone, so they wouldn't actually compete with any genuine stimulation of this pathway.

topic.title: There is no crab meat in Missouri???
topic.body:
I read a claim in various papers that Missouri had a law, not overturned, that prohibits calling anything meat that isn't from "animals with two or four feet".  Looking into it I found the bill ( https://www.senate.mo.gov/18info/pdf-bill/intro/SB977.pdf ) which says "production livestock or poultry".  They even had to file a law to make "deer meat" legal on a label! ( https://www.senate.mo.gov/18info/pdf-bill/intro/SB938.pdf ).  So I take it lobster meat and crab meat are _right out_.

They can say they're screwing the vegans, but it looks to me like whatever doesn't come from a factory farm corporation can't be sold as food.

topic.title: What are your bets on Brexit?
topic.body:
Sitting in the peanut gallery on the other side of the sea, I'll toss out my prognostication.  No, I haven't researched this, that would be cheating!  Also boring.  Let's see who's right.  All bets are paid in bragging rights.

My call:  No deal is accepted.  Johnson complies with his legal mandate to request a Brexit extension using a hand-lettered piece of whatever British call first class mail, dropped into a post box just before collection.  The world waits with baited breath as, smug that he has defeated what I'm going to randomly guess is a receipt deadline on the EU's end, he tells Parliament that the EU needs to receive it that day and it is locked safely in a mailbox.  The pro-deal forces make a valiant rally for an abject acceptance but fail, and Britain lurches toward a no deal Brexit.
... but meanwhile, a lone postmaster has loaded up the mail, snatched out the letter, put it on his little post office truck and is frantically racing toward the Chunnel...
For a moment, the return of perpetual delay seems inevitable, but just as he is about to cross into France, the heavy hands of MI5 grab hold of him and haul him off for trial for misusing postal resources by departing from his proper route with private mail.  The letter, held for evidence, reaches the EU sometime in 2020, to the bemusement of its foreign parliament.  The postmaster ends up in a cell next to Assange waiting for the world to end.  Brexit, at last, succeeds.

topic.title: Wikipedia has been censoring the Trump whistleblower's name (Eric Ciaramella) since at least October 24
topic.body:
WSWS published a post complaining about censorship of the Trump whistleblower name ( https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2019/11/11/face-n11.html ), which is kind of ironic since they're supposed to be on the other side.  But with the name I went back and looked at Wikipedia:  they, of course, have no article, and you're not allowed to make it, and in a show of what kind of site they are nowadays, they don't even have the LOGS to explain why you can't make it ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Log?type=&user=&page=Eric_Ciaramella&wpdate=&tagfilter= ).  Bear in mind that their ancient history was GFDL with everything public, so this kind of total barrier of silence took some "ideological effort" for them to get to.  As a result, they somehow neglected to cover up the corresponding file about DRAFTS of the page ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Log?type=delete&user=&page=Draft%3AEric_Ciaramella&wpdate=&tagfilter=&subtype= ).  Now that doesn't mean they didn't censor the page, but they left enough snippets that you can still see how long they've been doing it:


    17:01, 6 November 2019 Drmies talk contribs protected Draft:Eric Ciaramella [Create=Require administrator access] (indefinite) (Repeatedly recreated: BLP violation/attack page) (hist)
    17:00, 6 November 2019 Drmies talk contribs deleted page Draft:Eric Ciaramella (attack page/BLP violation: as yet, anonymity is sacrosanct)
    15:24, 6 November 2019 Redbeard927520 talk contribs created page Draft:Eric Ciaramella (←Created page with 'Alleged whistleblower in Trump/Ukraine scandal. Sources: https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/gop-congressman-asked-former-ukraine-minister-about-eric-ci...')
    14:05, 1 November 2019 Stwalkerster talk contribs deleted page Draft:Eric Ciaramella (G10: Attack page)
    10:07, 1 November 2019 2603:9000:5910:edbe:5507:4ef7:5fc7:ce75 talk created page Draft:Eric Ciaramella (←Created page with '{{subst:AFC submission/draftnew}}<!-- Important, do not remove this line before article has been created. --> The “Trump Whistleblower” Is Identified as Eri...')
    13:52, 25 October 2019 Stwalkerster talk contribs deleted page Draft:Eric Ciaramella (G10: Attack page)
    20:44, 24 October 2019 148.59.175.76 talk created page Draft:Eric Ciaramella (Who is Eric Ciaramella? News reports allege this is the so-called "Whistle-Blower" in the Trump/Ukraine Impeachment Scandal may in fact be Eric Ciaramella. >!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2KesdkpUtmA)

That last YouTube video is now marked as a "private video" so it is no use to me.  Obviously it wasn't a suitable source for Wikipedia.  But the interesting thing is, if we HAD a collective store of knowledge we could trace stuff like this back and see who leaked the name.  I mean, it was coming out anyway, don't give me shit about how the Russians and the Iranians won't know who a CIA agent is as long as it's only in 100 news stories in obscure outlets and you can't read it on Facebook!  Doing a regular search on Newslookup I can still go back and see some Gateway Pundit tweet from before that ( https://www.thegatewaypundit.com/2019/10/schumer-concerned-identity-of-secret-trump-hating-cia-spy-and-whistleblower-who-was-spying-on-president-in-white-house-may-be-leaked-by-trump/ ) which named him as one of two people, though the same site claims to have narrowed it down to only HIS name on October 12! ( https://www.thegatewaypundit.com/2019/10/more-on-the-now-infamous-eric-ciaramello-hes-connected-to-the-fake-steele-dossier-and-the-transfer-of-funds-from-the-imf-to-the-ukraine/ )  Right-wingers don't seem too bad at rewriting history themselves.

Now none of this adds up to a hill of beans - the usual idiotic arguments are being trotted out, where they say it doesn't matter what the transcript says because the guy who reported it was a Democrat who once went to a protest at college that favored a professor who allegedly was linked to Hamas.  Republicans read shit like that and they think he's a jihadist!  They make Joe McCarthy look like he had the legal mind of a Supreme Court justice by comparison!  Both sides are purveyors of wretched politics where they pull out a dossier of all the private details of somebody's life and throw out a few at random (there's always something) and then say that means they can get up on their throne _between_ the seraphim and damn the fellow to eternal hellfire.

BUT the conversation has changed.  It used to be that when you read about something in the news you can talk about it.  Now news is SECRET because the Masters of the World don't want you talking about it on their corporate-monopoly forums.  Somebody should just dump a pail of salt water down a manhole in Reston, Virginia to stop the world's internet forever.

topic.title: Tunable terahertz lasers - ULTIMATE disease ray - now officially invented
topic.body:
https://phys.org/news/2019-11-terahertz-laser-gas.html citing https://science.sciencemag.org/content/366/6467/856

I haven't been to Sci-Hub yet, but the tech details of the laser aren't what's important except in a Second Amendment sense.  The point is, this is VERY BAD FUCKING NEWS.  Just in "non-fringe" terms, we're talking about something that can not only penetrate through fairly long distances of solid material like X-rays, but which can ANALYZE CHEMICALLY what is in that space.  Fifteen years ago I was paranoid about this shit because the Chinese could use it to tell which kind of nematode worm had burrowed into a tree based on how its DNA absorbed the terahertz.  Nothing's changed ... except now it's cheap and formally on the menu.

But what is much more scary is that we're talking about the same potential for health effects as with cell phones etc., but now much more energetic photons.  Cause vibrations in DNA, displace transcription factors from their binding sites.  But not just at RANDOM.  We're talking SPECIFIC interactions.  So if somebody wants to build a Gay Ray, all they gotta do is displace the transcription factor that represses a male pheromone specific odorant receptor in your GnRH neurons projecting through the terminal nerve.  All of a sudden you're getting little pulses of testosterone when you smell a man, and before long the positive conditioning takes effect and you're getting a hard-on whenever you see cute guys (i.e. guys who match the average of the pheromone producers and therefore the conditioning).

Of course, it would be easier to work out how to cause cancer, but I doubt they'll do either - they'll just get some of their tunable lasers, point them at selected dissidents from drones, cross-index by their health records in six months and see what batches seem to have consistent health problems.  It's a hell of a lot easier than calculating the dispersion forces between a predicted protein and a DNA sequence!

We're getting real close to the end of the story now.

topic.title: The slave labor biology experiment that will END THE WORLD
topic.body:
Mad scientists have been trying to grow human brains on a chip for a long time.  Now they have one with BRAIN WAVES.

https://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/miniature-brains-send-out-brain-waves-first-time-180973784/

Let's be clear:  I've always used brain waves as the practical boundary of life.  If brain waves end, you pull the plug.  If a fetus develops brain waves, it's too old to abort.  Now this _thing_ has brain waves and complex development.

Why do this?  Because then they can get rid of their labor force in India!  Just make brains on chips that can't conceive of anything but coding or doing animation!

But there is a secret flaw, a **downside** these people don't understand, which is going to destroy them.  They think they are making a human from scratch, and they are, but they are not making it _right_.

Human consciousness is a paranormal phenomenon, and it is _based_ on a paranormal phenomenon.  The basis is precognition: the direct knowledge of the immutable future.  Knowing something _will_ happen can _make_ it happen, to the degree that anything makes anything happen when it is immutable.  As a result, the Universe is not a unique solution to a mathematical problem: there are MANY solutions.  Free will is generated by the choice of which self-consistent series of events turns out to be "real".  Qualia is the time inverse of this process whereby multiple past events come to a single present, and one is true and one is not.

But ... precognition is _dangerous_.  You think you're going to see an accident, so you pull off the road, get out, try walking around in the woods where you can't see the accident, you start to feel better, you come out, you startle a deer ... it runs in the road in front of a car, and you see the accident.  That kind of thing.  Think of how many people saw September 11th before it happened!

To keep consciousness relatively safe, humans have evolved some mechanism to _suppress_ precognitive memories at the macroscopic scale.  We don't know what the future is, so we don't see ourselves slipping and falling on a knife, then going out of our way to be careful... and falling on the knife.  We have paranoia, we have daydreams, we have things to pull the wool over our eyes.

These THINGS do not have any wool.  They are unlucky to exist at ALL.  There is no telling what pain and misery they feel.  There is no telling what they think.  And if anyone - ANYONE - with these things in their lab starts asking them about the future ... they're going to start getting answers.

We saw the first seal break with the Holocaust of the Jews, where law and crime became one and the same.  We saw the second seal break with low-intensity conflict, war is peace, pioneered in Israel as it turns out, until it is meaningless to _ask_ who we are at war with.  The third is breaking now - the rich don't _own_ things, they have a license to _use_ the Ring camera that is reporting them to the police and the cell phone that is selling keyword analyses of their conversations.  Soon they will not even own their cars, which will be self-driving monstrosities they have to beg to go places.

But this thing, with the fetuses - that is the SIXTH seal.  The last one before the end!  And they have got out the letter opener and are prying that baby with all their might.  And who in heaven or earth would say _"no, they don't deserve it, not just because they wanted the power to breed infinite numbers of little babies as tormented slaves on microchips!"_  Do I hear one?

The end - the end is NIGH!

topic.title: Dreaming of pinball in a parallel universe
topic.body:
Does anybody else dream of a universe where there is some other version of you and things are a little different but still recognizable?  Here's the trip report for an hour ago - have you seen such a game in our universe?

The pinball machine had four buttons of four different colors on the right side, and two? yellow buttons on a yellow panel in front for the rounds.  Buttons on the right side each fired a different kind of "cannon" - wooden cylinders painted each of the four colors pointing up at roughly a 45 degree angle at varying distances from a target hole.  I *think* holding down the buttons opened a valve to a cylinder of compressed gas; play involved slapping at the buttons a certain way/hardness to get the right amount so the ball shot to the right height where there was a goal.  You used the top? yellow button to start a round.

My twinner thought the game was easy and got all the way to the last round on his first ... quarter??  At which point a little LED? over the bottom button started flashing and he could press it to start the final round, which called over a human operator who would fire big white balls from a white cannon against him for a prize.  Twinner became disgusted that the game was a cheat, either because the cannon system was sabotaged somehow (white cannon had priority to get the gas?) or because the white cannon could fire many balls rapidly (there was a delay during which each cannon reloaded).  The game was set up in a room of small lockers, but public and open - possibly shoe storage for a bowling alley?

Psychiatric activity that may be modulated can include, but not be limited to, normal functions such as alertness, conscious state, drive, fear, anger, anxiety, euphoria, sadness, and the Fight or flight response._

topic.title: Can flax seed help against coronavirus?
topic.body:
So far I know a) coronavirus spreads during the incubation period, b) the first cases in various countries were handled like they were non-infectious before symptoms, c) the Canadians admit their case flew in with symptoms and now they're hunting back for who they flew in with.  In other words, _we're getting coronavirus just like the Chinese_.  Next question: what do we do about this?

1) According to https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28466096 (ask Alexandra Elbakyan about it) the deaths from coronavirus are simply from very high replication early on, followed by major inflammation.

2) To inhibit replication, flavonoids seem like leading options: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6882434/  Lead compound is herbacetin, which is part of a lignan - note the "A" in that - in flax seed.  Potency is around 1 uM, which is to say, 3 ng/L.

3) Flax seed has something like 34.5 **mg** of lignans per serving overall.  https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2951311/  Also note according to that paper lignans actually pass through the human circulation to the urine!

4) A newspaper from India treats flax like it's a well known weight loss supplement ( https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/life-style/health-fitness/weight-loss/flax-seeds-for-weight-loss/articleshow/60114327.cms ) and herbacetin has also been evaluated for *that*: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0009279718301637 This is some very indirect hint maybe it really is active in the body, though admittedly I just thought flax was used as dietary fiber.

Anyway, my best plan for coronavirus so far, such as it is, is leaning toward getting some flax meal / flax "flour" in the supermarket and using it as a supplement prior to infection.

Note I do not know how much if any free herbacetin you can get by eating it this way.  The procedure from that one paper involves microwaving ground flax on low for 6 minutes in lye solution, then purifying it.  Also I don't know how long herbacetin is stable for once isolated - I would think that the glycoside in flax, being part of the seed hull, might keep pretty well?????

Any opinions pro or con would be welcome - (people setting up blind studies in Wuhan would be great too)

    Unity: To strive for and to maintain unity in the family, community, nation, and race.
    Self-Determination: To define and name ourselves, as well as to create and speak for ourselves.
    Responsibility: To build and maintain our community together and make our brothers' and sisters' problems our problems and to solve them together.
    Economics: To build and maintain our own stores, shops, and other businesses and to profit from them together.
    Purpose: To make our collective vocation the building and developing of our community in order to restore our people to their traditional greatness.
    Creativity: To do always as much as we can, in the way we can, in order to leave our community more beautiful and beneficial than we inherited it.

You might not use a black, red, and _green_ flag.  The traditional tribal costumes probably also look a little different.

I don't think this would accomplish anything useful, but it would be really, really funny. :)

topic.title: Dreamed TV episode
topic.body:
I was dreaming of a version of myself in a parallel universe who was ... watching a TV series.  Guy is turning into a regular couch potato.  The latter part of the episode went as follows:

A cruel raider kidnaps women and hauls them away to his castle, presumably to rape.  The woman is left tied up to his war horse in the courtyard, and he tells her that if she moves, even a little, the horse will take off galloping and drag her to her death.  The raider is asleep after a pleasant and wine-soaked evening when he hears the bells on his horse's saddle, so he leaps up and starts riding another horse so he can follow and watch, together with a few retainers.  The scheme almost fails as he sees a momentary flash of his actual victim being supported on another horse riding away with someone, but he dismisses it and keeps following.  But it turn out that the horse he's following is the hero's own well-trained horse, and she is being dragged but in control with sword close at hand, to a place where angry villagers are waiting.

Could be worse... last week around this time he was watching (with great interest, it seemd) a dull documentary about all the times that Doctor Who had crossed paths with his French nemesis, the infamous Inspector Corlione, who did random things like pile up a nursery ward's worth of babies in precariously balanced drawers in a hallway to barricade Who from following him on board a large ship during wartime.

topic.title: PyrE to the People: coronavirus outbreak puts high quality bioweapons in the hands of every young adult
topic.body:
The world is run by old people, mostly old men - with a 15% chance of death from coronavirus.  The same virus can infect a young whippersnapper with less than a 0.1% chance of death.  Multiplicity of infection might also play a role: generally speaking, high doses lead to worse outcomes for any virus.  And the virus is now available for download ... just about everywhere.

In Iran, large chunks of the government became infected.  They blame U.S. agents.  It wouldn't have to be, though - any punk from one of the protest rallies could have done it.  He would simply have gotten infected, maybe on purpose, at the right time before the right event, then run around shaking hands.  Or licking dinner forks, if he wanted to be _rude_ about it.

This is true all over the world.  Powerful weapons of mass destruction hoarded by the privileged few are rivalled (for _some_ applications) by the thing the whole world is making dubious efforts not to get.  (The kids don't really care though - they are natural born terrorists in regard to every grandma and grandpa in the family, laughing off worries about the virus since it won't kill _them_)  There is not much they could do about it even if they _were trying_.  Maybe Xi Jinping could have some teenage boy shot for coughing in his face - maybe - but would someone in the American or Canadian government get anywhere trying to have someone jailed for touching the rim of a drinking glass?

This thought-turd has been brought down on your heads at the behest of Belial.  My apologies...

1565204231_1AM6ZY48ErJLzU89E7wPVjxoqyWuF.body:
The universe is a work in progress.  Think of a week of Genesis, and countless revisions afterward.  The dragon and the cockatrice disappear as if they never were; the world turns out to have been round from the beginning, and the stars are whole other systems.  A little short story turns into a vast book, rewritten from beginning to end.

The suffering we see has happened, will un-happen.  It will be washed away in the waters of Lethe, burnt up and forgotten in the fires of Hell.  What will remain: a story without the pain, where the characters have all the virtues that they displayed despite the miseries they endured, that no longer will be.  Every tear wiped away.  The mother who lost her son in a concentration camp and cried every day will feel, every moment she is with him, the joy she would have felt had they been reunited.  This joy is not Divine Dope, some kind of free opiate to make people feel good.  It is what they EARNED.  And their pain, their evil, their shortcomings, all away.  I suggest that salvation is partial, that moment to moment people are saved and damned.  What is damned, there is no more use for; it will be as if it never was.  What is saved, goes on.  But there may indeed be many, many universes, revisions, Days of Creation that stand between here and the final design of Heaven.
I'd love to hear an atheist explanation for where math came from.

Isn't it about time to ask why exactly child porn is such a high priority in this world?  I mean, either people get turned on by it, in which case it is international uncontested dogma that they are absolutely sick and absolutely incurable and (just as we would treat anyone with a serious mental illness), the only solution is to douse them in napalm and set them on fire -- or else people are NOT turned on by it, in which case what the fuck is the harm if they blunder into it and instead of wiping their hard drive in terror they feel free to email the cops and say look what I found, can you track down who is molesting this kid?

Not to mention that I've read claims that as much as $4 billion a year is made by people making fresh child porn, whereas if the pedos had some free stash they could all log into and wank, they wouldn't be paying kidnappers to do terrible things.

Money IS virtue and poverty IS crime.

1565329400_194xi8BJsLXhwje1kBJETKo6tjvhH.body:
The way I see it, in Germany people started off by bitching about the bankers who got all the money for everything and didn't do any work, just like in the U.S.  Then Hitler, a paid military agent, infiltrated the Worker's Party and started telling them, it's not the bankers, it's these *Jew* bankers.  Then he got them saying it's not just the Jew bankers, it's the *Jews*.  And before long the guy who lost his farm to a foreclosure or whatever has forgotten about trying to get a fair deal and is busy smashing up some Jew's dinky little shop and maybe plotting to steal his gold teeth.  After that he gets the privilege of either (a) being force to work 16 hours a day on the Autobahn living under primitive conditions for virtually no pay while the bankers party at with the Nazis at their chateau in the Alps, or (b) being bundled off to the Russian front without even a decent coat while the bankers party with the Nazis at their chateau in the Alps.

National socialism is just ought-to-be-socialists being pathetically duped, right to their deaths and a lot of other peoples' deaths.

Back in the 1990s, the Human Genome Project was going and everyone with any knowledge of genetics was pretty sure how it would go.  They would find that intelligence is a multifactorial inheritance like height, with many genes affecting it a little bit.  The frequencies of each form of each gene (allele) would be worked out in each racial population, and eventually it would be found that one race was statistically a little smarter than the other -- but then, of course, we would know that certain people in each race have larger genetic advantages or disadvantages.

The surprising thing is, IT DIDN'T HAPPEN.  It's not clear if there even are any genes affecting intelligence, and if there are, their effect is less than 1/20 the effect of a gene for height.  https://www.nature.com/news/smart-genes-prove-elusive-1.15858  Scientists are kind of at a loss to comment - they don't want to go back and propose that Descartes was right with mind-body dualism, but it's kind of unclear how else to explain it.  So they say "emergent phenomenon" which is scientist-speak for "it's complicated and we have no idea how it works".  Of course, we've been here before - nobody can prove brain size helps anybody think better, even though it had seemed obvious at one time.  And now the colleges are full of women, who big-brained men thought couldn't learn anything.

What if the human soul is indeed something beyond our comprehension?

Life in Africa never was a cakewalk either.  It certainly did not seem implausible that IQ could have diverged between the populations ... but where are the genes?

Historically, Rome in Europe and Carthage in Africa were seen as equal rivals.  Eventually the Carthaginians lost, mostly because the Sahara kept moving northward and cutting down their territory.  I think it was something like the 4th century where the Africans had to stop using horses and switch to camels because of the climate change.  Even after that, the Roman empire was basically the entire Mediterranean, which was the "highway" of commerce - think Anthony and Cleopatra.  Meanwhile ... it was the *whites* who were seen as funny-colored slaves brought in from backward remote areas.  In the 6th century, Pope Gregory I (who built the Catholic Church out of the ashes of Hun-sacked Rome) saw white slaves at the market and coined his version of "Black is Beautiful", saying "Non Angli, sed angeli" (not Angles, but angels).

I started looking for some more data and found http://www.unz.com/article/the-iq-gap-is-no-longer-a-black-and-white-issue/ which explains that when African nationalities are considered, some actually beat the whites while others are far behind.  It seems to have a lot to do with poverty, refugees from war-torn areas and so on.

Okay, first off I should say that my notion of "atman" is not really close to the HIndu usage, because I'm not convinced that non-human animals have the same kind of consciousness; sorry for the confusion.

Also, when I went looking for GWAS studies I found one I hadn't seen before (it's been a while since I looked) and this one is claiming 160-odd loci ( https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-018-0152-6 ) and I should look deeper before getting too carried away.  The abstract doesn't say how strong their effect is.  I must remember to visit with Alexandra Elbakyan this weekend.  Superficially, an intelligence gene that is "protective" against Alzheimer's sounds a lot like a gene for vulnerability to Alzheimer's which in itself is really cool to discover but not exactly what some have in mind.

> [saythenword](#comment_10_1PK8e7ccdA28Xi8mDbmZd6SLQSgZaxDAzg): There are humans walking around and living today who are almost entirely Denisovan

WHERE?  So far as I know they're extinct, but it would surely be interesting to find some.

@memesadler: Your quote makes me wonder if I could out racists with invisible ink tattoos by carrying around a UV light.  I literally had never heard of this ( https://www.bustle.com/articles/83234-5-uv-black-light-tattoo-risks-to-consider-before-you-get-that-cool-new-ink ) before reading your comment.

Now more generally in terms of species, Homo is a genus; all its members are considered "humans".  It's not clear the Neanderthals and Denisovans were substantially different in mind even if they had some kind of reproductive isolation.  One idea is that modern thinking is some kind of Neal Stephenson style linguistic virus transmitted to children (they put it a little less flamoyantly at https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/467183v1 ), but I'm skeptical - that paper seems to suggest deaf kids who had to resort to "homesign" can't learn to sew clothing.  By far the most awesome of all primitive human warriors were the little guys on Flores - they stood four feet tall and battled 24-foot long dragons tall as they are with a poison bite, armed with nothing but spears (that archeologists have found, that is).  Like to see the Vikings beat that.

I think the next human species is already emerging, but you'll be disappointed to hear that like all the others it's emerging from Africa.  They have all the genetic variation to work with.  *Homo apotelesmatis* is what we might the future species that could cross interstellar space - man influenced by the stars.  These people will manifest the brain power of any other human, but with a far higher brain/body ratio.  They are "Pygmies", in other words, living in separate little communities in Africa some of which are closely related to other humans and some of which are quite highly diverged.  If people are willing to recruit these people to train in STEM fields, train for space, test them physically for various obscure but highly useful traits to recruit to the population like the ability to belch in zero gee without vomiting, we will be able to set up space colonies far faster that grow faster, so they will outstrip the old species everywhere but in the local neighborhood of the Solar system.  If it pleases you though, rest assured that since space requires shielding for more than just a little UV, it shouldn't be more than a millennium or two before they are as white as the Queen of England.

@drgonzo:  It's funny - and not unexpected - to see the *non*-Nazis lose their temper first on this discussion.  Understand that this *does* cost us points.

The key thing to understand here is that these neo-Nazis, like others I've encountered, don't sound like marching morons.  See them IRL, and you'd think *OMG Krauts get me the tommy-gun!*  But these are not the same sort of people who went around Munich roughing people up and kept their mouths shut except to parrot propaganda.  *These* Nazis are distinguished by their *rarity*.  Understand that being an oddball is something very fundamental, maybe more fundamental than whether you back anarchism, communism, or naziism.  Look at them today, Nazis.  Look at them ten years ago or ten years in the future, half of them might be punks, antifa, who knows what.  It's not quite a costume party, but maybe it *would* be if there weren't so many moralists who want to ruin a guy's life because he once wore a KKK hood for a yearbook photo.

Plus, there's the inconvenient truth that Nazis like Mark Marek at Bestgore or the legions of comic trolls at Encyclopedia Dramatica are doing a lot of the heavy lifting of keeping the internet being not cable TV.  What kind of world is it where you look to Nazis to uphold your freedom of speech???

There's all kinds of stuff that the politically correct line of the corporations won't even allow a person to think about.  Reverse racism may not be as pervasive as regular racism, but it's absolutely real to the person affected.  Supporting Trump's immigration policy doesn't make you a Nazi, but if enough people tell you you're a Nazi if you support it, well, what could happen?  If somebody is drawn to interracial relationships, great, but if someone is drawn to intraracial relationships, they deserve an equal amount of respect and support... and with that, the recognition that no, the races aren't really going to all blend down to look identical in the next few generations.

So no -- let's cherish this free forum, this ZeroNet, with the idea that people who have different ideas can be free to talk.  The conversations are interesting.  If we have any faith in our being right, we should convince them more than they convince us.  And if they rub off some rough edges that make us sound like corporate dupes, that is a service.

> [memesadler](#comment_15_194xi8BJsLXhwje1kBJETKo6tjvhHmK73S): My argument against gay stuff, tranny stuff, and other abnormal sexual cases goes back to ingroup survival.

Reproduction is obviously a basic drive in humans.  Apart from Sparta I can't think of any culture that died out due to lack of interest in it.  However, reproduction is not essential for all individuals.  This is taken to an extreme in the social insects, of course, but most species have some nonreproductive members.  Having some people with different goals helps the survival of the whole -- otherwise, natural selection would have stopped homosexuality before mice, whales, or monkeys branched off from our ancestral line.

This is especially true during periods of overpopulation, whether we speak of mice in a cage or humans destroying the planet.  When you see a lesbian, think *"Well, that's two kids I won't have to kill with a bayonet for the last cans of beans in a burnt-out Wal-Mart"*

1565256550_149W17bFN1NbQou6iE81Uq2b8wEvy.body:
*Absolutely NO* on #1.  ZeroNet seems to make it easy to link files from other locations.  As a new user, reading all this FUD about child porn (and of course there's all sorts of other copyright crap and so on), I like the idea of being able to subscribe to a text forum and not even be thinking about whether files are being sent out while I read.  ZeroTalk is the "front door" and you need it to be as newbie friendly as possible.

*Yes* on #2.  In addition, having permanent servers helps establish the idea that Section 230 applies.

*?* on #3.  I haven't tried it, but I was under the impression that anyone could "clone" ZeroTalk and set up a new forum.  What is really needed is some kind of mostly-agreed-on hierarchy of groups after the fashion of Usenet, but it will have to grow gradually in step with readership.  That and really convenient tools to navigate between them.  But for the love of all that's holy, *do not* re-invent cross-posting!

*?* on #4.  Every post has some ID listed at the top.  If you want private messaging, shouldn't that be a function of the ID server, or some other site rather than the talk?

*?* on #5.  It is appealing but why wasn't it set up in the first place?  Is there a spam issue and how would you approach it?

*Yes* on #6.  I'm not sure exactly how you have in mind to set it up though.  My impression was that ZeroNet plans ZeroTalk to be basically one newsgroup, and if you want another newsgroup you start one that is totally separate from ZeroTalk.  But I don't know how you do that and get seeders to keep it going.  But having a whole lot of forums under one roof like 08chan means one spammer can bring them all to a halt and a concern about legality on one forum is going to make everyone on every forum paranoid.  So while any tool to see what's going on should be good, the deeper philosophy needs to be explained/decided better.

*Absolutely yes* on #7.  Although I could have sworn I've already looked back at my old postings somehow...  definitely we should have it if not.

There could be some use for using the likes as part of an anti-spam system, together with some other proof-of-work scheme.  But forums that show only the posts people liked are FUNDAMENTALLY different from forums that don't.  They are absolutely the property of whatever PR agency can arrange a network of likes for its own people and dislikes for those it wants shut up.  If you're a bot, join Reddit - if you're a human, don't sort posts by likes.

Request for feature: I would like to have a way to comment *without* promoting the thread.  Sometimes there's some kind of trolling, you want to answer it, but you don't want to see it stay at the top of the rankings.  I want it both ways.  The net result should be better content at the top of the thread, *without* giving PR networks any special advantage in promoting their content.

1565321865_18Eg3doTf26uabVuTnryFMUk9cKEz.body:
The key thing here is that the users are operating a telecommunications service for each other.  In other words, they should have a "Section 230 safe harbor", in the U.S. anyway.  (Since most of the users -- really, we should say "peer maintainers" perhaps -- are in the U.S., it won't matter that much if nobody else seeds anything)  But you have to get somebody convincing online (page the EFF, the ACLU!) to say that yeah, that's really true.  AND to provide tips to the peer maintainers how not to screw up their safe harbor.  I think there's something about encouraging the content uploads for example.  Real lawyers issuing opinions are needed, not just guessing.

We should remember though that this is by far not the first time that child porn has been weaponized against crowdsourced websites.  For example, Wikipedia was investigated by the FBI back in 2010 ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reporting_of_child_pornography_images_on_Wikimedia_Commons ) after an ex-founder pushing Citizendium (which uses a real-name policy like China/Facebook) reported them.  They actually *kept* some things that would make you wonder.  And of course, they *do* have honest-to-god child porn uploads now and then.  But note that the FBI did not go and prosecute any of their amateur administrators who ended up looking at the images in the course of their duties.  It's a minefield, but Wikipedia crossed it without casualties, and so could ZeroNet.

1566074416_1PGDKdsYUcJajEbqqgb91pJp1rUzz.body:
"Qualia" is the most important of the paranormal phenomena.  It is how we "really feel something" rather than just giving an impression of life like a doll with a microphone and a pull cord, or an AI.  "Free will" is related; in fact, it is the time-inverse.  Qualia is how consciousness relates to the low-entropy past, which is a typically losing battle you might say, while free will is how it affects the high-entropy future.  Both are something of a give and take.

Now where does free will come from?  Not where you'd expect.  Free will results from the _certain_ knowledge of the _immutable_ future, in other words, precognition.  In a macroscopic context, of course, precognition pretty much savages free will, which is only one of the reasons why it is more trouble than it's worth.  But it also creates free will, because it means there is more than one solution to the equation that is the universe.  If you pull a ticket out of a machine, that has a number on it, which is whatever number you are going to put into the machine a minute from now, and you don't look at the ticket, but put it in the machine a minute later, what was the number?  NOT random.  NOT determined.  It's a causality violation, pure and simple.  And causality violations are the boundary conditions of the Cosmos.  They link our reality to the alternate dimensions, the days of creation before and ahead of us in spiritual time.  You, me, WE are the gateway of the creation of this world, the manifestation of the creative process that moves on from one universe to the next.

1566178418_1aaGBN84Cc8VE7iocUxPXiRVhx9qS.body:
Qualia/free will exist despite the immutability of the physical future because our universe is linked by additional dimensions of time to parallel universes beside it.  Human consciousness is the point of connection: very short range precognition creates causality violations that impose the boundary conditions of the cosmos.  So consciousness may also be able to sense or explore some of these parallel universes though they remain closed to ordinary methods of scientific investigation.

There can be no certainty with it, but dreaming offers the possibility that you can perceive what your direct counterpart in another universe can perceive.  This comes through _as he perceives it_, so for example if he is watching a movie you might see the fantasy as real if he's immersed in it.  Playing with dreams means mixing in a lot of fantasy, no doubt there.

For a long time I was dreaming about "Verse Prime", a place that seems not far from here, but with some neat differences.  They have some kind of electrostatic propulsion for gliding through the air, so you can throw a Bar-Dart that will fly several blocks to the stadium and try to hit a player or official in a non-life-threatening spot.  This also means that instead of covering the buildings in fan equipment, they cover them in gardens - there's a mandated maximum height in New York and it seems like the whole city is roofed with parks and gardens.  They actually just finally discovered something similar here ( https://phys.org/news/2019-07-ultra-thin-layers-rust-electricity.html ) but only in water and only to absorb the energy so far.  Less population, and the British? Colonies are smaller - the Zoroastrian Persians got the Louisiana Purchase I think, and there was some unpleasantness involving nihang with mecha-chakrams on gliders, etc.  Look for ridiculous amounts of wrought iron, even on the ATMs and bridge underpasses, and seemingly all the windows made out of Plexiglass and usually scratched up.

The transdimensional organizations seem to be avoiding us because of orthogonality violations.  In theory, every trans-dim is based on an eigenvalue of the human condition, so conflict between them (or even alliance) is impossible.  But around here?  Well, The Reich/Rich is supposed to be about relentless economic/industrial expansion; whatever we have going in our verse is way out of whack.  And Signal is supposed to show up first to make first contact and share tech but they're no where to be found it would seem.

You can also kind of imagine or see through to the other dimensions sometimes.  I mean, you see some ornamental towers built for no purpose at all and you realize you're seeing an echo of the pickets of a military camp over there; you see guys with big long necklaces and you're seeing the mecha-chakrams that use electrostatic propulsion to spin at deadly speed over there; you see the tattoo plague here and it's the echo of some kind of skin disease over there.  We're kind of an amelioration of their problems, but then we get new problems of our own.

If something you're accessing is more serious than government censors wanting to block it to virtue signal -- say, if you had Epstein's financial client list and holdings -- then if you read that file it is on your _computer_.  And, well, in the past week I saw Avast twice decide to up and transfer pieces of ZeroNet into the "virus chest" on account of "IDP:Generic" unspecified behavior, and that (like all anti-virus programs) has terms and conditions that inspire less than zero confidence.  So what do you think would happen if you had a file that somebody with a lot of cash or power was really, REALLY looking for?  (Yeah, you could turn off the virus checker, except the one in Windows, and Windows has terms and conditions that look like they might have been written by the same people).

At some point you have to take a hard look and realize that sourcing technology built by and in communication with untrustworthy people all over the world isn't actually viable.  We're going to have to start looking to brew up some Dark Age tech -- whether we wait for the Dark Age to start first, or not.

Question is: do WE have a plan?

First, we need a way to respond without bumping the post.  I'm OK with it being public - like just change the reader so a ~ character as the first character of the post means it isn't counted toward the newest posting date.  So if I want to respond to some outrageous bait, I can without feeling guilty.

Second, we need to SPAM this forum with GOOD CONVERSATION.  This post is good, but not good enough: you won't attract people with just "why does this forum suck?"  When you read an article and it makes you say hmmm, think of opening a thread here.  We do it what a dozen times a day, more?

Third, we need some threads that are almost "sticky" because you never get tired of talking about them.  "big science news", that kind of stuff.

Fourth, we need a way to quickly go to threads that have DROPPED OFF THE TOP OF THE LIST.  We need an easy way to look back through all the threads (like a way to TURN OFF infinite scrolling ... *hate* Web 2.0!) and "bookmark" the ones to go back to.

> [kaffie](#comment_1053_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Just being able to pull up any medical research with no paywalls, submitting your own papers, etc

You _do_ know about Sci-Hub?

ZeroNet Sci-Hub is hard.  You would need a constant stream of people sending reprints into the repository, because new papers are always coming out.  You'd need a LARGE amount of distributed disk capacity.  Only a few dozen people in the whole world might request an interlibrary loan of any one item, so who would seed it?  And then there's the factor that pushing this first would play into the hands of someone trying to attack ZeroNet as an "illicit file sharing network" rather than as a general internet protocol.  It's not something that some guy is going to do in a few months.

OK, after a few minutes in the shower this is what I came up with:

a) You can keep your first-come-first-served system, possibly with some more spam protections.

b) The key reform is that you don't treat the domain names as **property**.  That way lies the root of all evil.

c) If a person wants to supersede an existing freely-registered recent domain name, all they have to do is pony up $10 to Oxfam or Unicef or one of a few other charities.  (Catch is you have to figure out some way to work with them to document unique receipts).  That gets a "level 1" registration.

d) If someone else is really hot to override that name (the original 'owner' perhaps) all they have to do is pony up $30 to Oxfam or Unicef and come back with a receipt.

e) Continue on at $100, $300, $1000, $3000 etc. levels.

f) When people register personal domains, give them some kind of free level progress over time.

g) Last but not least: owners at any level, including free, should be able to put up "fraud alerts" on some of their URLs (not the main page).  If a domain gets co-opted, you have the client watch for those URLs and warn the reader to contact you if they're getting sent there.  This would have to be a different piece of data from the name, though.  This should defeat if someone takes over a URL to get at a payment address.

1565899855_141zS75MupoDVjN4p7ivG9pXUXjAm.body:
Some more information for the user is good, but no matter how good a tool it is, Tor can be a trap.

a) You don't want to give the impression that ZeroNet is somehow inherently illegal (and by extension ANY communications _protocol_ as opposed to _platform_ - see https://knightcolumbia.org/content/protocols-not-platforms-a-technological-approach-to-free-speech ).

b) You don't want to give people a false sense of security with Tor.  Ever since I installed this program a few weeks ago I've been hearing a lot more activity out of the supposedly ultrasonic virus that tries to find airgapped computers.  I don't know if it's built into Microsoft or just infects everybody - and to be sure, it seems way more subtle than it was when it first came out, I only hear it 30 seconds or so out of a day now vs. constantly for two laptops ago (then again, my hearing is also going downhill fast in those frequencies) - but it is a reminder that on a Windows system you have spies, Microsoft, your "free" antivirus checker carefully examining every file ... pretending you have privacy is just a mind game.  (It just did it now when I went in ZeroNet)  Maybe Linux is better but I have yet to see an easy way to just go to the nearest store and pick out a cheap Linux box that is ready to run.  We're not all ready to spend hundreds on something we don't know if we can get to work, especially when the back of my mind says surely I'm going to hear this spy shit going off anyway.

c) NOBODY thinks the quantum computers are not going to crack the passwords on Tor eventually, and nobody seriously believes there aren't voluminous archives.
It would seem more than ample to post his IP address or his office phone number ... but that would probably be just as illegal and punishable as if you'd done all that other stuff.

> [duck0](#comment_143_17bfQv5PQW9FZ4akChr7ECfqP2SKuAXwM5): Tinnitus [...]

Tinnitus doesn't have patterns and pitches to it.  There's a silly free game by the name of Dwarf Fortress, which I had gotten with no built-in sound because their sound is pointless, and I had the speaker down, and because it goes on and on I would even hide the window on the screen, and it had a tendency to pause itself at random intervals over various silly announcements.  I could HEAR when it paused itself, based on the 'ultrasound' coming from the laptop.  (It doesn't come from the speaker, it's like the motherboard or something making the sound)  To be sure, that didn't work on the next two laptops, which only go through their ultrasound pulse for a short time once in a blue moon - that was after the story came out in the press, so I suppose they must have modified it.

1567131012_1BXEpDnqmAicgL8QvAVh6erxpVZY3.body:
There is only one past, only one present, and only one future ... in this universe.  A consequence of this is that precognition has dangerous or annoying side effects.  I mean, you were furious that the same day you got your side mirror replaced somebody else was going to hit it, and even though you delayed going to the shop for two weeks because you were pissed off about that, it's still gonna happen.  When you start doing things just because you know you're going to do them, free will seems to go away.

At the same time, free will is just that - doing things because you're going to do them.  There is more than one solution to the math problem that is the universe.  So if you have a machine that sends a digit a minute back in time, where you type the same digit into the machine, what digit is that going to be?  NOT random, because you never did anything random.  NOT determined, because there's no way to figure out what it is.

Yeah, free will results because the future can't be changed.  I know that gives some people trouble.

But where does the free will come from then?  If it's "your choice", then how do you choose it?  Well, because you're either outside the universe or at this boundary where the causality violation is determining what the universe is.  Perhaps the universe is linked to other parallel universes that are very similar at every point, in a second dimension of time, and that's where you make the decisions.  Spiritual time you might say, compare to Days of Creation or New Heaven and New Earth.  This is obviously a wide open speculation since it is hard to see beyond this universe!

Not sure it is impossible though.  In our dreams and speculations, maybe we recall or see some of these other worlds.  And there could be transdimensional organizations at work that have a better understanding of these things...

1567722717_1D6UcmziWg55aXV6TnCksXpjsFJ4g.body:
It is a good site, but having been there I must take a moment to take apart your anarchy.  You discuss for example whether anarcho-capitalism can be anarchism and so on.

Anarchy, simply put, is the sum of all human rights.  The problem is that __ANYTHING__ that can be worded as a law can be worded as a right.  As you well know, the "anarcho-capitalists" will insist your right to sell yourself (and your descendants?) into slavery is a vital right to uphold.  But the leftist anarchists are more than eager to proclaim the "right" of a laboratory rat to be freed from the burned-down remnants of the lab that was trying to use it to cure cancer.  Few anarchists want to answer whether in an anarchist society there is a right to a trial by jury.

Because any law is any right, anarchism is simply the rephrasing of "politics".  As above, so below.  Except it isn't really even a matter of ditching organization, because as you know, the first thing you talk about is building syndicates and such.  Anarchists can be organized, they can enforce rules (er, I mean rights).  And I have a distinct suspicion, though I've never seen it verified, that they are also prone to corruption, not merely in the sense of becoming police informers but in terms of choosing specific ski resorts to burn down based on some criminal organization's agenda.

All of this does not put you any WORSE than the state, and having a dual perspective of law and right can be enlightening, but in the end I threw myself out of the anarchists because I couldn't follow their rules.  I'll take government money whether for work or subsidy and use it to buy a nice juicy steak and I won't feel one bit of regret about it.

The more important innovation is to work on formulating a list and logical derivation of human rights.

Number one, if some murderer DID this to you, don't let him win.  Forget that shit.

Number two, you sound like you need to do some subjective introspection.  What ARE you?  What IS the world, or love?  When you feel prolonged pain, whether it is physical or psychological, try to reason out what it is.  What IS pain and why do you respond to it at all?  This works to lessen the impact whether it's a gout attack or losing your mom.

Number three, consider religious ideas.  This world is just one of a sequence of parallel universes, the Days of Creation you could say ... different versions of the same manuscript.  In the next version the pain you feel will not exist, but the _virtue_ you display will.  You will be _with_ the one you lost, but you will still be feeling all the strength of emotion you feel now being apart!  But if you cut your story short now, the time you can enjoy in the next version will probably be reduced.  (I don't think it will be the last word though - I think there are MANY revisions of Creation behind us and very very many in front of us before the Kingdom of Heaven)  Also consider that all consciousness is a single force, a single experience, there's no more difference between two people than two lobes of the same brain.  If you're hurting, consider going out and helping someone who is down on their luck themselves.

Number four, no, a lot of the people here probably don't really understand you.  To be "on the spectrum" is to have the freedom to stand mostly apart from some of the biological imperatives.

Oh yeah, and number five:  statistics show that headshrinkers and helplines and such do overall have a chance to help.  They're not exactly a miracle cure for misery, but there's no sense at all in checking out before you check out your OTHER options.

(And last but not least, in the all too likely chance this is a fedpost, I salute the troll but it would be far more satisfying and impressive for you to troll in the direction of leaking who pays you and why to Wikileaks.)

1568749254_14kTJXu4KZSoWSSNcGtXEijf4NqEG.body:
There's a thesis and an antithesis here and that is a good thing.

We KNOW that blocking is immensely disreputable.  Every service on the former Internet claimed to "only block for a few special things" and now all of them are busy deciding which politicians are OK and which ones violate their TOS.

We KNOW that the trolling here is a pain in the ass, and that it is orchestrated by forces hostile to freedom of speech.

So this is put up or shut up time.  Collide these two and form a synthesis, an act of creativity that has never been done before.  We have to come up with better ways to let people work together to rate what they want to see and deal with and what they don't.  **Developing a free and fair forum is the central problem of democracy.**  It is not an easy problem, it is a very hard one, and it MUST be done right or else everything goes to shit.

I feel like this problem is related to the problem of collaborative writing.  A group of people, members of 34 different organizations with different perspectives, each one with their own affiliations, want to get together and propose a piece of draft legislation.  _What is the right way for them to sit down and create that draft?_  Our present answer is: let the best-paid lobbyist author it, and get everyone to sign on because it's what they heard of.  I think we can do better.  And if we DO better, then people who might compose one or more rival drafts of legislation in the political arena might also compose lists of people they want to follow or not follow in conversation.

My favorite solution is the Zeus Drone.  Basically, read this: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lightning_rocket  Now picture you have a sturdy drone with decent AI that can try to navigate to a position inside/near a thunderstorm (and knows to hold off if it can't!) , that has some of that conductive cable.  There are little switchable breakpoints in the cable every few meters.

Down below, Kim Jong Il is standing on his fancy new submarine a short way out in the ocean.  The Zeus Drone's controllers have TOP NOTCH weather data that shows all the winds and charge distributions in the thunderstorm, so it knows when to drop its ball of conductive thread.  It also knows the exact distance from the ground so it's not left with a large incriminating ball of conductive thread at the bottom.  The cable unspools and the control fins on the dropped module work to keep it on track to within a few centimeters.

When the cable is a fraction of a second from the dictator, it slows down, and the conductive switches all throw to link it up.  Perhaps a static electricity generator makes part of the drone's surface extra appealing to a lightning bolt.  The rest, as they say, is history.

Should the Zeus Drone fail to do its thing, the cable splits apart at the switches, relying on wind to carry it as little bits of debris that nobody knows the purpose of.  But hopefully it did its thing.  Nukes or not, North Korea can scarcely mobilize a retaliatory mission over an _act of God_, can they?

1570819630_1DLLxLPEjC4xmHBo235fGQLC2dauv.body:
Consider the following quote: _"By accusing M------ of paedophilia, [E.S.] had merely sought to defame him, without providing evidence that his primary sexual interest in A------ had been her not yet having reached puberty... In particular, [E.S.] had disregarded the fact that the marriage with A----- had continued until M------'s death, when she had already turned eighteen and had therefore passed the age of puberty."_

I think a person should have a right to say that, indeed, a right to say that without being tossed unceremoniously out of a computer science department.  But the European Court of Human Rights is another matter, because in fact they not merely _said_ this (about Muhammad, not Minsky, and quoting an Austrian verdict they were **upholding**), but went on to _enforce_ it as a boundary of what is illegal to _disagree_ with.  ( https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2018/10/its-not-free-speech-criticize-muhammad-echr-ruled/574174/ )

I don't know, but I assume that violating European human rights laws and being found guilty by a court would _also_ get a person thrown out of MIT.

What this means is that in a "most respected" university, the state of academic freedom is such that it is ABSOLUTELY IMPERMISSIBLE to express an idea like the one above, and ABSOLUTELY IMPERMISSIBLE to disagree with it.  The only tolerable course of action is simply _not to think about pedophilia at all, for any reason_.  Accordingly, if you go to https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed and search for _pedophilia_, it gives 1035 results, and if you apply a filter from 10-1-18 to 9-30-19, you get **35** results.  By comparison, you get **181** results for _liposuction_ for the same yearlong period.  It should not be surprising then if we hear that pedophilia is incurable, since practically no one is interested in curing it - indeed, if it is not safe to talk about it, and probably not safe to look it up or even think about it, then it can be argued (especially by a computer science department) that pedophilia passes the Turing test for _not existing at all_, save as a form of prohibited philosophy.

But when universities accumulate larger and larger classes of things people must not think about or make any suggestion concerning, what exactly is their purpose?  They are relics, the white elephants of some bygone age, that have no place in the shiny new Dark Age coming.  And there is surely no department more than a computer science department for which we _cannot see that day come fast enough_, before they have finished enslaving us all.

The thing I want to know most is -- what do pheromones do for you?  I mean, when I was three I was 100% heterosexual, but around five there were some incidents with this post-pubescent boy I'd never looked at twice before who would hassle me and when he would try to block me from going around a table to the kitchen and I smelled that sweat...  OMFG that wonderful scent definitely added on an extra orientation (on my part, that is) within about three half-hour periods of interaction.   When you're exposed to pheromones it OUGHT to condition you to think of their source as attractive, and so long as most people you are around are adult, that ought to be what you get set/reset to.  You might or might not consciously smell the pheromone (probably not).  If there's some blockage in the pathway ... maybe there's a way to just get a better sniff of the scent?  Just make sure obviously you can associate it with the adult producing it, and for the love of God don't do this when you're around some temptation involving a kid just in case this all goes sideways.  This comment is very hazy since I don't know your situation.

I don't believe pedophilia is an "orientation".  Come on -- haven't you been a kid?  To this day I remember the name of the girl in my 7th grade class who first started growing breasts.  At the time I definitely preferred how she looked to how the adult teachers looked.  THINGS CHANGE.  There's no logic to an evolutionary type-casting here.  Pedophilia is simply a disease, nothing else - one that might be treated or cured if people would try.

I highly doubt that incest was ever "normal".  The thing to bear in mind is that incest brings recessive genes together, causing their abnormal phenotypes to be revealed right away.  It's not "bad" in some "eugenics is good" sense, but in the sense that every other gene in your genome wants to get clear of the sinking ship before it pulls them down!  So no, incest is going to repel people, because the genes that feel repelled get shuffled into other descendants before the recessives meet and go boom.

The comparison of infibulation to child sexual abuse is a valid and interesting argument.  It is a subset of the question of why an assault - even an aggravated assault - is considered less severe than the rape of an adult.  There are a large number of psychological sources that argue the extreme harm done via sexual means, to the point that it is difficult to be skeptical, and yet also it is difficult to understand. You're driving down the freeway and get pulled over and breathalyzed.  Why?  Because multiple-frequency terahertz scanners were able to measure the amount of ethanol in your blood while you were driving past. EVERY CHEMICAL absorbs different amounts at different frequencies.

You get pulled over and hauled off to a Camp because you were recognized by a DNA signature -- because specific gene sequences will resonate at different frequencies, and you are probably related to some idiots who got their gene sequences run by one of those companies.
