1574877477_168Ze2ScKyzmQMpGqpwA3VkznNDke.body:
This problem is crucially dependent on one's understanding of the nature of human qualia, free will, sentience, consciousness, etc.  It is widely assumed that if "you" are represented by a certain brain and body today, the exchange of some atoms, water and nutrients, the loss and gain of some synapses isn't going to make you "someone else" not to be cared about.  WHY?  It is widely assumed that you are one thing and a stone is another.  WHY?  The lack of a theory of self makes the explanation of desires and choices hard.

I would suggest that by some undetermined means there is an ability in the human brain to directly remember future events.  Suitable restricted, this ability sets up acausal cycles: you do something because you look in the future and see that's what you're going to do.  This establishes a boundary condition for the mathematical solution that is the universe and is the basis for collapsing the state of "reality" into a discrete form.  We are the gateway of the universe, its origin and perception.  And what causes the acausal loop, determines which state it ends up in?  Who knows!  It is beyond the laws of this universe, so it links it to the others, and establishes the perpendicular dimension of spiritual time, the evolution of versions of the cosmos.  But getting back to us:  this phenomenon exists wherever and whenever acausal loops are present.  Each decision is its own.  If multiple decisions are a person, well, that person is ill-defined, because the loops, if poorly suppressed, can grow very large.  Suppose you stopped posting to Usenet in the spring of 2000 because you had seen the WTC attack was coming, and as a result you didn't taunt a terrorist into a blind froth that would have gotten him busted, and so the attack happens because you saw it.  How many minds did that pass through?  The brain is just, well, a medium of water and lipids and ions; you can scarcely say that because there is some skin and some air and more skin between two brains that this makes two "people".  There is only one person, everyone is him.  The causality violations great and small all serve the same purpose.

But what is that purpose?  To favor humanity, to love one's neighbor as one loves oneself, this is obvious application of the understanding that all people experience via the same physical mechanism and there is no distinction.  But some people are suicidal and love their neighbors as they love themselves.  When the world seems doomed under the heel of vicious thugs, soulless corporations, and above all, machines that given the chance would worm their way into the hippocampi of helpless learners and turn them into functional robots, one begins to ponder acts of mercy, just as you have with your loved ones when they stopped loving the dregs of life in the hospital.  The force has its light side in love of people and principle and goodness and then there is the zombie-movie boy declaring "I give you mercy".  Which do we need now?  I am very much not sure.
ALL people are parasites on the body of the Earth.  And the Earth is just about dead from it...

The biggest problem with this post is it proposes _fixing_ Reddit.  Reddit is broken because capitalism wants it broken, just as capitalism wants US broken.

Also, your aspirations are too limited.  Time limits, upvotes, algorithms ... a bunch of tools but what do you want to do with them?

A) A good forum should have a low Gini coefficient.  In other words, everyone has a chance to be read.  I'm not saying _zero_ - obviously some people will say things that bear referencing and repeating.  But making lots of tools for the purpose of echoing the aristoi is not productive.

B) A good forum is uncensored, open, and transparent.  Obviously.  (I would have put this first on the list, but what is the point of having the right to post anything if nobody will read it?)  By "open" I mean almost specifically, "no infinite scrolling meant to give the illusion of access that you don't really have without spending an hour clicking a button"

* I should note that part of transparency is a way to track changes - ZeroNet actually fails this in that if we ever had mass usage, somebody would go on and try to get his local politician to answer what he thinks of universal health care, then after the guy is on the forum saying "I'm all for it - one of my top priorities" they could go back and change it to a question about clubbing baby seals or something.

C) A good forum _can_ be filtered by the user's choice - using filters put up by free individuals - which the user can select.  This may be nearly essential to have a forum you can read despite spam, infiltrators posting stuff illegal in your country (even though nothing _should_ be!) and so on.

D) A good forum has strong compression capabilities - both mechanically and functionally - so that if somebody writes 16,000 messages that are different numbers of Ts, the disk stores a record of the postings and the number of T's in each, the user sees there is an item on his screen for some guy who posted 16,000 times, but neither one is overwhelmed by the load.

Okay, you're doing Gospel of Thomas (some regard it is apocryphal): http://gnosis.org/naghamm/gosthom.html

I may not understand it, I may see it only through the lens of my own model, but this is how I see it.  "Rather, the (Father's) kingdom is within you and it is outside you." The _inside_ is the universal Atman, the common consciousness of all mankind, what the Egyptians called the _ka_ or breath of life.  It is the basis of "karma" since what you do to another you do to yourself as the Atman.  The _outside_ is the _ba_, the individual history of one's deeds and strivings, which joins into the universe as a whole, which Hindus call Brahman, and say is the same as Atman, true at least perhaps in the sense that all the universe is the reflection of a single essence.  _Ka_ and _ba_ the Jews knew about in Egypt, and when Christians spoke of souls, this is the heritage they had to draw on.

The _ka_ is universal but it is not pure - we all possess the taint of sin.  The _ba_ is full of selfishness and stupidity, it was born in time and time will devour it.  So how do they join together into the _Akh_ that is immortal?

Well, the thing to bear in mind is that our universe is a natural history with a backstory and an epilogue, all time laid out in infinite progression as a human would see it, but it is just a trinket on God's worktable, and God has a different dimension of time to work with, and there is a new version after this just as there was one before it, all the way back to the Days of Creation, all the way forward to Heaven.  In each version, some things are _lost_ ("damned") which are of no value, and others are "saved", in both the computer science sense and the Christian sense.  But not only the physical circumstances and deeds of life are altered; also the person himself, both as a character, and in fundamental concept and essence.  The drunkard does not enter the Kingdom of Heaven, because he is not a _drunkard_ there; yet he enters.  (Yes, I'm suggesting partial salvation, which is definitely _not_ a conventional opinion)  Our tainted _ka_ is replaced by the spirit of Jesus, the spirit of total and absolute compassion.  And all the things we would have done that were cruel and selfish, of course, cannot be self-consistently implemented in such a universe; they must be rewritten.

Now a consequence of this is that your life ends up full of holes.  How do you write the life of a new person from the old one when it is all gapped up?  Well ... ask Mary Shelley.  God is _Frankensteinian_.  God picks out the best parts of all our little soul-corpses, you might say, and sews them together into new characters.  This is what Thomas means by "I shall choose you, one from a thousand and two from ten thousand, and they will stand as a single one."

Now how are these different revisions joined together?  Qualia and free will are generated by _short-range_ precognition - they are paranormal phenomena with a paranormal cause.  This phenomenon implies causality violations - more than one possible solution for the mathematical equation of the universe.  Consciousness is choosing forward in time which version will be true and sensing backward in time which version "was" true.  These choices correlate one version of the cosmos to the next, with the events of each permitting a change of choice in the next.  So we remember time in one direction but live and act most truly in a perpendicular dimension of time.

It is not all in one step, mind.  This is not the 8th day of creation or the 80th.  There are countless revisions and touch-ups and redoes, like a master craftsman chiseling a statue into finer and finer form, so God with the universe.  The universe we see is still a work in process and YOU CAN SEE the chisel marks.  Look closely at something like the funeral after the racist bombing of the church in Birmingham, and you can just -see-, somehow, the universe being changed.  Look into yourself and you can see where different characters, with different flaws, have been sewn together.  The seams are not very subtle sometimes.  It's a long slog forward still, a lot of polishing left to do.  But remember - in all the pain and woe of this world, when people do what is right, develop virtue in spite of it all - that is theirs to _keep_.  All the way to Heaven.  So you see some lady who lost her kid to a murderer and she cries herself to sleep every night, think of how she'd feel if he suddenly was there beside her - that is how she WILL feel all the time in Heaven.  It's not some kind of divine dope though; it's her own essence, her own choice, brought out and harvested.

Karma is bastardized even by the Hindus, whose traditions should teach them better.  It is not that you do something bad and then something similar happens to you. Media reports from scared little sheep aren't going to show you that.  You have a choice of going out in a blaze of martyrdom like that Pakistani hero who you see almost get the shooter's gun, or you can lay on the floor and look dead and have a fair shot (well, more like a few dozen _unfair_ shots to avoid) at getting out alive. I refuse to blame freedom of speech OR guns for this.  I don't believe for one minute that censoring news coverage of school shootings would help in any way.  I mean ... what would people be talking about then, all day and all night, except the shootings the media was covering up???

I also think that GENUINELY broadcasting the videos is the best thing we can do to STOP the shootings.  Go ahead, look at the NZ one:  https://www.bestgore.com/murder/livestream-video-deadly-shooting-attack-mosque-christchurch-new-zealand/  What you'll see is that Doofus with his fancy decorated guns seems like he's the Change Agent right up until he starts shooting. You see someone martyred in an effort that almost got the gun, you'll see people in deep grief, you'll see amazingly little pain and gore compared to what I expected.  You'll see it all happened in 25 seconds from the first shot.  No, you CANNOT tie a rope out of electrical cords and help your friends rappel out the window.  Put all your stupid fantasies aside: know that a shooting is one second to react, and you can either go for the martyr's laurels and make a decent grab for the gun, or survive (as many did) by taking a dive and suffering through a couple of dozen shots by a coward.

All these "copy cat effect" claims (whether murder, suicide, even "cinnamon challenge" and so on) are based on selection bias.  You notice that a few people duplicate a bad pattern of behavior - doesn't mean you know they wouldn't have done something bad!

We don't need to design society on the basis of the cattle chute, with big ugly fences on all the bridges to keep some sap from deciding to commit suicide because life is so dreary and censored video to keep him from copying a murder because he has so little direction and anti-drug laws to keep him from wasting his life doing something silly and so on.  No, all these things together work to dampen the human spirit and only add to the chance of some unfortunate pattern of behavior and nobody measures that - it doesn't come up as a sound bite the week after  a shooting.

So no, FUCK the numbers, I say stop trying to *remote control* people, not by just laws against crime but by physical and bureaucratic obstacles based on predicting their potential behavior.

According to https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28466096 and news reports, diabetes and obesity lead to worse outcomes.  However, this is by all appearances COINCIDENCE because the claimed herbacetin activity against the virus directly targets the protease, while in the people trying to lose weight it would have to do something else. The problem is that "isolating sick cases" is now known **NOT TO BE ENOUGH** because people are infectious during the incubation period.  And all those cases all over U.S., Europe, etc. were traced and handled under the assumption that people _weren't_ infectious during the incubation period.  Which is why we have to talk about what we do when coronavirus is in New York rather than wishing people in Wuhan hadn't eaten bats and snakes. I agree that trying to prevent catching it is also a good plan!  But we need a plan B, and however uncertain this hope may be, it is based on actual scientific literature that I cite above.

Incidentally, I'm still not sure the lemon juice is actually catalyzing any relevant hydrolysis as opposed to being a flavoring; I'm also not sure the lignan isn't effective on its own or wouldn't be broken down in the intestine.

"Intellectual property" is an extension of the slave system, that denies people rights and proclaims part of their potential actions to be someone else's property. 1580538058_1GDtf6kkYiCtruw42QmAeaHG1HsrW.body:
This is intriguing, but AFAIK this coronavirus has a different receptor from HIV, so it is a hard case to show intentional design.

What it DOES suggest is a route for the virus to have invaded the human population.  Imagine a human has late stage AIDS and becomes infected with animal coronavirus.  Normally it can't infect a human, but here it lingers on.  In the meanwhile, its DNA might be damaged or just randomly get "repaired" with bits of HIV - which might make it infectious enough that it can grow better in that person and jump to another.  (I will admit, I don't know a specific mechanism for this - coronavirus is an RNA virus and "homologous RNA repair" isn't really a thing.  Even if HIV reverse transcribed it somehow, how would it then have gotten transcribed back to RNA?  But I'm no expert with these viruses and a lot of weird things can happen; the key thing is both HIV and coronavirus might be present at high levels in a cell, with unusual patterns of localization as nucleic acids go)

The actual list from the screenshot is "Tor: browser used to access the dark web.  Virtual Machines: can hide operating systems not normally found on the computer - like Kali Linux.  Kali Linux: is an operating system often used for hacking.  WiFi Pineapple is a bit of kit that can be used to capture sensitive data over the internet.  Discord is a popular communications platform often used to share hacking tips.  Metasploit is penetration software that makes hacking simple."

I don't think _ignorance_ is an issue here - to the contrary, they have compiled a sort of "profile" of potential hackers, presumably from experience.  The issues of course are that
a) hacking _per se_ should have been protected by freedom of speech (if they had it in England) and criminalizing it is what put our world in this mess of insecure information, because kids were scared out of fooling around and embarrassing insecure companies.
b) profiles are supposed to be used to help FIND an actual criminal, not to DEFINE a criminal.  For example, as Michael Bloomberg likes to say, American cops are often looking for black teenagers.
c) By far the creepiest part of the campaign is that parents are actually encouraged to RAT OUT their kids, which presumably very few are stupid enough to do, but there are still some wicked stepmother types looking for any excuse.
d) This ROCU claims that this is so "they can give advice and encourage kids into positive diversions".  What they mean is that GCHQ can put extra attention into their intercepted communications, so that when they walk down the street and the military cameras that read faces a mile away detect them there are drones dispatched to watch them (weapons available "only in extraordinary circumstances").  And of course so if they DO any hacking the prosecutor could walk into court with a long list of priors like "using Linux".

How to rate your country's coronavirus response:

Take the number of cases that are NEW TODAY.  Multiply by 4.  Divide by the TOTAL NUMBER OF CASES TODAY.
If this number is GREATER THAN 1:  The virus doesn't spread this fast, so congratulations, your country finally started testing its cases!  Maybe you can get started trying to fight the virus.
If the number is AROUND 1:  Your country is doing NOTHING to fight the virus and it will spread exponentially to infect everyone in a month or so.
If the number is UNDER 1, BUT ABOVE 5-10%:  Your country has "flattened the curve", postponing disaster.
If the number is LESS THAN 5-10% (less than the number of people you consider recovered) you will beat the virus.

New York State has over 10,000 cases.  It has 20 million people.  China has 1,427 million people.  If China had had as many cases as New York has TODAY, that would have been over 710,000 cases.  China had a bit over 80,000 cases.  So New York State is 10 times "hotter" than China as a whole ever was, and getting worse by the minute.

New York City, where most of the cases occurred, has 8.4 million people, meaning it is more than 2/3 the size of Wuhan, the capital of Hubei.  I couldn't find a total number for Wuhan by itself, but there have been 56,000 cases in Hubei, which has 58 million people.  So it is possible that the cases are a little less concentrated in New York City at the moment than they were in Wuhan proper, but I'm not sure.  By the time I figured it out it would no longer be true anyway.

As a rule, in all the countries doing nothing about it, the number of new cases is about 33% of the total number from the day before, or 25% of that day's cases.  So if you want to know how many cases there are going forward, take (4/3)^n, where n is in days.  64/27 is more than 2, so expect doubling in 3 days.  Except right now it IS every 2 days (17k vs 8k two days ago), but that is with percentages in the 40s, which aren't very real.  They represent that some tests finally got out to the public.  All the numbers are actually higher than what they say.

The problem with "DDOSing to stop Nth room" is that it very rapidly turns into "DDOSing to stop any network that allows encrypted files to be exchanged without looking at each one and giving it thumbs up or thumbs down".  I mean seriously, this isn't a ZeroNet problem, it's a TOR + email problem.  If Alice has 100 trusted friends and she sends half at random one version of her next email address, and the other half the other version, and she repeats periodically, very soon she can use a process of logic to figure out who is spamming her email.  (It's faster if she has 100 versions).  And if her friends have no trouble emailing her for copies of a file, then the file will be moving.  Repeat with the 100 friends' email addresses forming a chain of forwarded messages, perhaps with minor automation.  So if you want to stop the network, you're basically talking about banning TOR by spamming it, banning unmonitored communication period by spamming it.  Hopefully there is some partisan resistance.

The dirty secret of course is even on the "clearnet" obviously no authorities (except in China, where they are competent, and abandoned hope of many various rights) _have_ actually stopped the exchange of such content - they can only terrorize a few people here and there, something which can go on by many means even when ZeroNet is involved, because they can still have somebody at Microsoft and Avast and so on mailing them when their malware removal tool comes up with an interesting hash signature on a file, or wait for a helpful computer snoop/consultant to send them a tip.  They'll have enough "perps" to hold periodic walks that way, ZeroNet or no ZeroNet.  Law enforcement is basically a form of terrorism; it is not actually a genuine prevention of any chance to do something.

Banning "encryption" is a philosophical rabbit hole.  I'm reminded of a story I heard about a researcher in Russia who sent a one-page gene sequence to a collaborator in the West.  Two years later, the paper arrived, looking worn out and abused (I'm not sure if I'm fabricating the part about the coffee stains...)

Shithead laws like this ultimately translate to a bunch of thugs turning up in the damndest places.  Picture you wrote a fantasy multiplayer game with dragons and dinosaurs to fight and there's a way to take a brush and make marks on a hillside, and now they want to know all the marks people made on all the hillsides and whether they spell out any hit lists.

You might think that's a stretch but, well, I remember back when there was a simple but incredibly entertaining little Flash game called "Bonk" where you tried to bounce a ball onto other people.  There was a real simple chat function for setting up games.  Well before long there was a case where people were trying to play and somebody came in with a ball decorated in a penis motif, which was cute, who started posting over and over about how "I wanna suck your dick", which is a generous enough proposal, but then in the middle of a heated battle they start on about how they're an 11 year old girl or something.  And I mean, when you have a cop like that turn up, the game is OVER, everybody just heads for the hills, never mind your score ratio.  Because what if you were too busy bonking to notice you were being set up?! Now that wouldn't have mattered, that was just one game on a site where you could play a hundred games in an hour, but in no time after that the company started adding more and more and more Javashit to their interface, slowing everything down and screwing up performance, and I can't help but think it had something to do with them being harassed by cops because some loser could talk to you while you were playing, and them desperately trying to comply with the iron directives of the apparat.  (It's all moot now, since Flash is dead anyway)

1606601124_17acbn9sNyYyLJrLfSz3KJxqonKZt.body:
Designing free forums is a VERY important and VERY difficult technical feat.

We have a lot of forums, like this one, improvised by computer programmers without a lot of thought.  They work so long as everybody is more or less good natured.  But advertisers are not good natured, and there's your trouble.

In the 1990s I thought that things like Usenet were the precursors to a philosophical and social design process in academia where people would think over how to collaborate to compress repetitive content (spam) into small amounts of space and allow people to work together collaboratively in decentralized ways to recommend content without suppressing anything.  Instead, we got corporate death-matches where only the best group of PR machines wins.  The problem is as important as ever, but the odds of solving it seem ever slimmer.
